name: StoneCutterInventory
description: The `StoneCutterInventory` class provides specialized access to Minecraft's stonecutter interface, allowing scripts to interact with stonecutter operations such as selecting crafting recipes and managing stone-based crafting recipes. This class extends the base `Inventory` class and adds stonecutter-specific functionality for managing available recipes, selecting specific recipes, and accessing recipe outputs.

methods.name: getSelectedRecipeIndex
methods.description: Retrieves the 0-based index of the currently selected recipe in the stonecutter interface. Returns -1 if no valid recipe is selected or available.

methods.name: selectRecipe
methods.description: Selects a recipe in the stonecutter interface using its 0-based index. This action updates the output slot to display the selected recipe's result.

parameters.name: recipeIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index of the recipe to select.

methods.name: getAvailableRecipeCount
methods.description: Returns the total number of recipes that can be crafted from the item currently placed in the stonecutter's input slot (Slot 0).

methods.name: getRecipes
methods.description: Returns an array of `ItemStackHelper` objects, where each object represents the output item of an available stonecutter recipe for the current input material.

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Retrieves an `ItemStackHelper` object representing the item currently displayed in the stonecutter's output slot (Slot 1). This is the item that would be crafted if `quick(1)` is called.

methods.name: canCraft
methods.description: Determines if the currently selected recipe can be crafted. This is `true` if an input item is present and a valid recipe is selected.
